verses.verse: The first of the week Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early while it was still dark and saw the stone had been taken away from the tomb.
So she ran and came to Simon Peter and the other disciple, who was Jesus' friend, and said to them, "They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they have laid him."
Then Peter and that other disciple went out and came to the tomb.
They were both running, but the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first.
Stooping down, he saw the linen clothes lying there, but he didn't go in.
Following him Simon Peter came, went into the tomb, and saw the linen clothes lying there.
The cloth, which was around his head, was not lying with the linen clothes but rolled up in a place by itself.
The other disciple, who came to the tomb first, then went in, saw, and believed.
But at that point they didn't know the Scripture that he must rise again from the dead.
Then the disciples went back to their home.
Mary was standing outside facing the tomb crying, and as she weeping, she stooped down to look into the tomb,
and saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head and the other as the feet where the body of Jesus had been lying.
They said to her, "Woman, why are you crying?" She said, "Because they have taken my Lord away, and I don't know where they have laid him."
After she said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there but didn't know that it was Jesus.

Jesus said to her, "Woman, why are you crying? Who are you looking for?" She, thinking that he was the gardener, said to him, "Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away."
Jesus said to her, "Mary." She turned around and said to him, "Rabboni!" (This means teacher.)
Jesus said to her, "Do not touch me, for I have not yet gone up to my Father. Go to my brethren and say to them, «I ascend to my Father and your Father, my God and your God.»
Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord and that he had said these things.

Then that same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors where shut where the disciples were gathered for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them and said to them, "Peace to you."
After he said this, he showed them his hands and side. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
Again Jesus said to them, "Peace to you. As my Father has sent me, even so I send you."
After he said this, he breathed on them and said, "Receive the Holy Spirit.
"If you forgive anyone's sins, they are forgiven; if you retain, they are retained."
Now Thomas, one of the twelve, called the Twin, wasn't with them when Jesus came.

Therefore the other disciples said to him, "We have seen the Lord." But he said to them, "Unless I see the mark of the nails in his hands and put my finger into the mark of the nails and thrust my hand into his side, I will not believe."
Eight days later the disciples along with Thomas were inside with the doors shut. Then Jesus came and stood among them and said, "Peace to you."
Then he said to Thomas, "Put your finger here and look at my hands. Reach your hand here and thrust it into my side. Do not be faithless, but believing."
Thomas answered and said to him, "My Lord and my God."
Jesus said to him, "Thomas, you have believed because you have seen me? Blessed are those who have not seen yet believe."
And Jesus truly did many other signs in the presence of his disciples that are not written in this book.
But these have been written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life through his name.
